intro: Euphrasia krylovii, commonly known as Krylov's eyebright, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in alpine environments. It produces a basal rosette of leaves and has hairy stems that help it retain moisture in arid conditions. Euphrasia krylovii is often found in high-altitude meadows and is adapted to cold climates.
